parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game2</name>=<value> arma2

</value></part><part><name>version2</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game3</name>=<value> arma2oa

</value></part><part><name>version3</name>=<value> 1.51

</value></part><part><name>game4</name>=<value> tkoh

</value></part><part><name>version4</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game5</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version5</name>=<value> 0.50

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control - Positioning

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Moves mouse pointer to specified position on the screen. '''x''' and '''y''' could be any number, but will be clipped so mouse never leaves the screen area.

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> '''setMousePosition''' [x, y]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> x: [[Number]] - x in screen coordinates

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> y: [[Number]] - y in screen coordinates

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[setMousePosition]] [0.5, 0.5];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[getMousePosition]], [[ctrlMapCursor]], [[reversedMouseY]]
</value></part></template></root>
